intro: Echeveria perelegans, commonly known as the Blue Echeveria, is a succulent plant native to Mexico. It features dense, compact rosettes of blue-gray, spoon-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, powdery coating. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences with showy purple or pink flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, requiring minimal water to prevent root rot. Due to its striking appearance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and container planting.
